chapter.title: ReBar Controls
chapter.para: The ReBar class provides methods to work with and manipulate the underlying Windows rebar dialog control which it represents. It is a concrete subclass of the dialog object and therefore has all methods of the dialog control object.

In addition to the methods of the class itself, the following methods from other classes in the ooDialog framework are needed, or are useful, when working with rebar controls:
Instantiation:
Use the method of the object to retrieve a new ReBar object.
Dynamic Definition:
To dynamically define a rebar in a class, use the method.
Event Notification
To connect the notifications sent by the underlying rebar control to a method in the Rexx dialog object use the method.
Window Creation:
To dynamically create a rebar window in a dialog, use the method. This can only be done after the underlying Windows dialog has been created.

section.title: Method Table
section.para: The following table provides links to the documentation for the primary classes, methods, and attributes used in working with ReBar objects, including the pertinent classes, and methods from other classes:

row.entry: Returns a ReBar object for the control with the specified ID.
Creates a rebar control in the dialog template of a
Creates a rebar control in an existing Windows dialog.
Connects rebar event notifications to a method in the Rexx dialog object

section.title: newReBar (dialog object method)
section.para:
ReBar objects can not be instantiated by the programmer from Rexx code. Rather a ReBar object is obtained by using the () method of the object. The syntax is:
>>-newReBar(--id--)---------------------><

section.title: createReBar (UserDialog method)
section.para:
A rebar control can be added to the dialog template for a dialog through the () method. The basic syntax is:
>>--createReBar(-id-,--x-,--y-,--cx-,--cy-+---------+--+-----------------+--)-->< +-,-style-+ +-,-attributeName-+

section.title: createReBarWindow (CreateWindows method)
section.para:
A rebar control window can be created and added to any dialog through the () method. The basic syntax is:
>>--createReBarWindow(--id--+----------+--)------>< +-,-style--+

section.title: connectReBarEvent (dialog object method)
section.para:
To connect event notifications from a rebar control use the () method of the object. The basic syntax is:
>>-connectReBarEvent(--id--,--event--+----------------+--+--------------+--)---->< +--,-methodName--+ +-,-willReply--+

section.title: ReBarBandInfo Class
section.para: A ReBarBandInfo object represents a band in a . The attributes of a ReBarBandInfo object define a band in a rebar. A rebar band info object is also used to retrieve information about a band.

section.title: Method Table
section.para:
The following table lists the class and instance methods of the ReBarBandInfo class:
